oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Record of Presence of the Invasive Land Flatworm Platydemus manokwari (Platyhelminthes, Geoplanidae) in Guadeloupe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Justine, Jean-Lou
Winsor, Leigh
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Platydemus manokwari
Guadeloupe
invasion biology
invasive species
Geoplanidae
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>The land flatworm Platydemus manokwari (Platyhelminthes, Geoplanidae) is recorded for the first time from the island of Guadeloupe (French West Indies) in the Caribbean arc. Photographs and records were obtained from citizen science and ranged from the end of 2018 to 2020; specimens were deposited in the collections of the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris, France. This is the first record in Guadeloupe and the second for an island in the Caribbean, after Porto Rico.</jats:p>
